DOC.brief_summary: Insulin resistance in men can be the underlying major factor in reproductive abnormalities ( chronic hypospermatogenesis ) as well as metabolic abnormalities similar to polycystic ovarian syndrome ( PCOS ) in women.
DOC.brief_title: Insulin Resistance in Idiopathic Oligospermia and Azoospermia
DOC.detailed_description: During the past decade IR has been recognized as a major contributor to the pathogenesis of chronic anovulation, hyperandrogenism and metabolic abnormalities associated with PCOS . Theoretically IR in men may result in a similar reproductive abnormalities ( chronic hypospermatogenesis ) as well as other metabolic abnormalities similar to what happens in PCOS in women .
DOC.criteria: sperm count less than 10 million per milliliter nonobstructive azoospermia high FSH ( > 10 mIU/ ml ) high prolactin ( > 36 mIU/ml ) abnormal karyotype AZF
